00072 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00073 
00074 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00075 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00076 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00077 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00078 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00079 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00080 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00081 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00082 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)

00084 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00085 
00086 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00087 
00088 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00089 
00090 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00091 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00092 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00093 
00094 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00095 
00096     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00100 
00101 {
00102     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00103     unsigned long flags;
00104 
00105     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00106 
00107     adeos_load_cpuid();
00108 
00109     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00110         {
00111         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00112             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00113         }
00114     else
00115         flags |= 2;
00116 
00117     return flags;
00118 }
00119 
00120 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00121 
00122 {
00123     if (!(flags & 2))
00124         {
00125         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00126 
00127         rthal_cli();
00128 
00129         adeos_load_cpuid();
00130 
00131         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00132             {
00133             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00134             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00135             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00136             }
00137         }
00138 
00139     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00140 }
00141 
00142 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00143 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00144 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00145 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00146 
00147 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00148 
00149 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00150 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00151 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00152 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00153 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00154 
00155 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00156 
00157 #define XNARCH_NR_CPUS               RTHAL_NR_CPUS
00158 
00159 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00160 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00161 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00162 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00163    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00164    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but rather an APIC-based
00165    timer interrupt instead. */
00166 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00167 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00168 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00169 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00170 /* Using 3/4 of the average jitter is some constant obtained from
00171    experimentation that proved to fit on tested x86 platforms with
00172    respect to auto-calibration. In any case, a more accurate
00173    scheduling latency can still be fixed by setting
00174    CONFIG_RTAI_HW_SCHED_LATENCY properly. */
00175 #define xnarch_adjust_calibration(x) ((x) * 3 / 4)

00178 #define XNARCH_ROOT_STACKSZ   0 /* Only a placeholder -- no stack */

00216 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00217 
00218     /* Kernel mode side */
00219     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00220     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00221     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00222     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00223     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00224 
00225     /* User mode side */
00226     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00227     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00228 
00229     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00230     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00231     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00232 
00233 } xnarchtcb_t;

00251 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long ts) {
00252     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00253 }
00254 
00255 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00256     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00257 }
00258 
00259 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00260     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00261 }
00262 
00263 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00264     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00265 }

00268     return adeos_processor_id();
00269 }

00275 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00276 do { \
00277     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00278     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00279     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00280     for (;;) safe_halt();                       \
00281 } while(0)

00286 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00287 
00288 {
00289     spl_t s;
00290     splhigh(s);
00291     splexit(!!imask);
00292     return !!s;
00293 }

00297 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00298                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00299                                                    void *cookie),
00300                                    void *cookie)
00301 {
00302     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00303 
00304     if (!err)
00305         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00306 
00307     return err;
00308 }
00309 
00310 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00311 
00312     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00313 }
00314 
00315 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00316 
00317 {
00318     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00319         return -EINVAL;
00320 
00321     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00322 
00323     return 0;
00324 }
00325 
00326 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00327 
00328 {
00329     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00330         return -EINVAL;
00331 
00332     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00333 
00334     return 0;
00335 }

00338     rthal_pend_linux_irq(irq);
00339 }
00340 
00341 static inline void xnarch_isr_enable_irq (unsigned irq) {
00342     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00343 }

00345 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void) {
00346 
00347     rthal_pend_linux_irq(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00348 }

00359 void xnpod_welcome_thread(struct xnthread *);
00360

00362 
00363 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00364 
00365 {
00366 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00367     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00368 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00369     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00370        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00371        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00372        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00373        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00374        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00375     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00376 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00377 }
00378 
00379 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00380                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00381     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00382 }
00383 
00384 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00385 
00386 {
00387     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00388 
00389     adeos_load_cpuid();
00390 
00391     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00392        and always inside a critical section. */
00393     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00394     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00395     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00396     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00397     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00398 }
00399 
00400 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00401     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00402 }
00403 
00404 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00405                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00406                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00407                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00408                                     )
00409 {
00410 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00411 
00412     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00413         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00414         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00415         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00416         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00417         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00418         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00419         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00420         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00421         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00422         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00423         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00424         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00425         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00426         "ret\n\t" \
00427 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00428         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00429         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00430       : /* no output */ \
00431       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00432         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00433         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00434         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00435         "b" (out_tcb), \
00436         "S" (in_tcb), \
00437         "a" (outproc), \
00438         "d" (inproc));
00439 
00440 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00441 
00442     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00443     
00444     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00445         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00446         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00447         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00448         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00449         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00450         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00451         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00452         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00453         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00454         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00455         "ret\n\t" \
00456 "1:      \n\t" \
00457       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00458         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00459         "=S" (esi_out), \
00460         "=D" (edi_out), \
00461         "+a" (outproc), \
00462         "+d" (inproc) \
00463       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00464         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00465         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00466         "m" (in_tcb->eipp) \
00467       : "ebp");
00468 
00469 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00470 }
00471 
00472 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00473                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00474 {
00475     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00476     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00477 
00478     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)        
00479         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so that the ts
00480            bit need to be cleared. */
00481         clts();
00482     
00483     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00484 
00485     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00486         {
00487         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00488 
00489         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00490 
00491         if (!inproc->mm)
00492             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00493         }
00494 
00495     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00496 
00497     stts();
00498 }
00499 
00500 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00501                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00502     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00503 }
00504 
00505 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00506     /* Empty */
00507 }
00508 
00509 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00510 
00511 {
00512 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00513 
00514     if (!tcb->user_task) /* __switch_to() will take care otherwise. */
00515         {
00516         clts();
00517 
00518         if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00519             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00520         else
00521             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00522         }
00523 
00524 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00525 }
00526 
00527 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00528 
00529 {
00530 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00531     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00532 
00533     if (task)
00534         {
00535         if (!task->used_math)
00536             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00537 
00538         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00539            hardware. */
00540         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00541         }
00542 
00543     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00544        user-space or kernel thread. */
00545 
00546     clts();
00547 
00548     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00549         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00550     else
00551         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00552 
00553 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00554 }
00555 
00556 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00557                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00558                                          const char *name)
00559 {
00560     tcb->user_task = current;
00561     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00562     tcb->esp = 0;
00563     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00564     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00565     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00566 }
00567 
00568 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00569 
00570     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00571     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00572     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00573     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00574     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00575     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00576 }
00577 
00578 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00579                                                int imask,
00580                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00581                                                void *cookie)
00582 {
00583     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00584     stts();
00585     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00586     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00587     entry(cookie);
00588     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00589 }
00590 
00591 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00592                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00593                                        void *cookie,
00594                                        int imask,
00595                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00596                                        char *name)
00597 {
00598     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00599 
00600     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00601     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00602     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00603     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00604     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00605     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00606     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00607     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00608     *--(*psp) = 0;
00609 }
00610 
00611 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00612 
00613 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00614 
00615 {
00616     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00617        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00618 
00619     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00620 
00621     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00622         {
00623         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00624         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00625         }
00626 }
00627 
00628 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00629 
00630 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00631 }
00632 
00633 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00634 
00635 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00636 
00637     while (!*flagp)
00638         {
00639         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00640         schedule_timeout(1);
00641         }
00642 }

00644 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP

00646 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00647 
00648     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00649 }
00650 
00651 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00652 
00653 {
00654     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00655                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00656                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00657                                      NULL,
00658                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00659 }
00660 
00661 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00662 
00663 {
00664     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00665                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00666                                      NULL,
00667                                      NULL,
00668                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00669 }
00670 
00671 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00672 
00673 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00674 {
00675     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00676 }
00677 
00678 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00679     
00680 {
00681     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00682     cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00683     unsigned long flags;
00684     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00685 
00686     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00687 
00688     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00689        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00690        context. */
00691     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00692                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00693 
00694     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00695     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00696     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00697     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00698 
00699     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00700         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00701     
00702     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00703                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00704 }
00705 
00706 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00707 
00708 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00709 
00710     return 0;
00711 }
00712 
00713 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00714 
00715     return 0;
00716 }
00717 
00718 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00719 
00720     return 0;
00721 }
00722 
00723 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00724 
00725 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00726 
00727 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00728 
00729 {
00730 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00731     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00732        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00733     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00734 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00735     xnshadow_release_events();
00736     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00737     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00738     schedule_timeout(50);
00739     xnarch_release_ipi();
00740 }
00741 
00742 static inline void xnarch_escalate (void) {
00743 
00744     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00745     adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00746 }
00747

00749 
00750     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_ATOMIC);
00751 }
00752 
00753 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes) {
00754 
00755     kfree(chunk);
00756 }

00758 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void) {
00759     
00760     xnshadow_grab_events();
00761 }
00762 
00763 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00764 
00765 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00766 
00767 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00768                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00769                                            const char *name)
00770 {
00771     struct task_struct *task = current;
00772 
00773     tcb->user_task = task;
00774     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00775     tcb->esp = 0;
00776     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00777     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00778     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00779 }
00780 
00781 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00782 
00783 {
00784     unsigned irq;
00785 
00786     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00787         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00788                              handler,
00789                              NULL,
00790                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00791 }
00792 
00793 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00794 
00795 {
00796     unsigned irq;
00797 
00798     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00799         {
00800         switch (irq)
00801             {
00802 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00803             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00804             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00805             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00806             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00807 
00808                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00809                 continue;
00810 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00811 
00812             default:
00813 
00814                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00815             }
00816         }
00817 }
00818 
00819 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00820 
00821 {
00822     unsigned irq;
00823 
00824     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00825         {
00826         switch (irq)
00827             {
00828 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00829             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00830             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00831             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00832             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00833 
00834                 continue;
00835 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00836 
00837             default:
00838 
00839                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00840             }
00841         }
00842 }
00843 
00844 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00846 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00847 
00848 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long long delay) {
00849     /* Delays are expressed in CPU ticks, so we need to keep a 64bit
00850        value here, especially for 64bit arch ports using an interval
00851        timer based on the internal cycle counter of the CPU. */ 
00852     rthal_set_timer_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00853 }
00854 
00855 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00856     rthal_release_timer();
00857 }
00858 
00859 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00860 
00861 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00862 
00863 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00864 
00865 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00866 
00867 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00868 
00869 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00870 
00871 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00872 {
00873     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00874 
00875     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00876     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00877     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00878 
00879     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00880 }
00881 
00882 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00883 
00884 {
00885     int err;
00886 
00887 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00888     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00889        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00890     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00891 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00892 
00893     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00894 
00895     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00896         return -ENOSYS;
00897 
00898     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00899                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00900                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00901                               NULL,
00902                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00903 
00904     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00905 
00906     err = xnshadow_init();
00907 
00908     if (err)
00909         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00910 
00911     return err;
00912 }
00913 
00914 static inline void xnarch_exit (void) {
00915 
00916     xnshadow_cleanup();
00917     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00918     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00919 }
00920 
00921 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00922 
00923 #ifdef __cplusplus
00924 }
00925 #endif
